00041 sub _stringify {  
00042     my ($object,$argument,$flag) = @_;
00043     return unless ref($object);
00044     $argument = "" unless defined $argument;
00045     $flag    = "" unless defined $flag;
00046     #warn " object ".ref($object);
00047     #warn " args $argument";
00048     #warn "flag $flag";
00049 #   my($name) = '""'; &_trace($name,$object,$argument,$flag);
00050     my($rows,$cols) = ($object->[1],$object->[2]);
00051     my($i,$j,$s);
00052     
00053     $s = '';
00054     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )
00055     {
00056         $s .= "[ ";
00057         for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )
00058         {  #warn " i $i j $j ",$object->rh_options;
00059             my $format = (defined($object->rh_options->{display_format}))
00060                          ?   $object->rh_options->{display_format} :
00061                                         $Matrix::DEFAULT_FORMAT;
00062             $s .= (ref($object->[0][$i][$j]) =~/Complex/) ?
00063                       " ".$object->[0][$i][$j]->stringify_cartesian." " :  #FIXME
00064                       sprintf($Matrix::DEFAULT_FORMAT, $object->[0][$i][$j]) ;
00065         }
00066         $s .= "]\n";
00067     }
00068     return($s);
00069 }
00070 
00071 # obtain the Left Right matrices of the decomposition and the two pivot permutation matrices
00072 # the original is M = PL*L*R*PR
00073 sub L {
00074     my $matrix = shift;
00075     my $rows = $matrix->[1];
00076     my $cols = $rows;
00077     my $L_matrix = new Matrix($rows,$cols);
00078     for (my $i=0; $i<$rows;$i++) {
00079         for(my $j=0;$j<$i;$j++) {
00080             $L_matrix->[0][$i][$j] = $matrix->[0][$i][$j];
00081         }
00082         $L_matrix->[0][$i][$i]= 1;
00083     }
00084     $L_matrix;
00085 }
00086 sub R {
00087     my $matrix = shift;
00088     my $rows = $matrix->[1];
00089     my $cols = $matrix->[2];
00090     my $R_matrix = new Matrix($rows,$cols);
00091     for (my $i=0; $i<$rows;$i++) {
00092         for(my $j=$i;$j<$cols;$j++) {
00093             $R_matrix->[0][$i][$j] = $matrix->[0][$i][$j];
00094         }
00095     }
00096     $R_matrix;
00097 }
00098 sub PL { # use this permuation on the left PL*L*R*PR =M
00099     my $matrix = shift;
00100     my $rows = $matrix->[1];
00101     my $cols = $rows;
00102     my $PL_matrix = new Matrix($rows,$cols); #rows=cols
00103     for (my $j=0; $j<$cols;$j++) {
00104         $PL_matrix->[0][$matrix->[4][$j]][$j]=1;
00105     }
00106     $PL_matrix;
00107 }
00108 
00109 sub PR { # use this permuation on the right PL*L*R*PR =M
00110     my $matrix = shift;
00111     my $cols = $matrix->[2];
00112     my $rows = $cols;
00113     my $PR_matrix = new Matrix($rows,$cols); #rows=cols
00114     for (my $i=0; $i<$rows;$i++) {
00115         $PR_matrix->[0][$i][$matrix->[5][$i]]=1;
00116     }
00117     $PR_matrix;
00118 
00119 }

00128 sub rh_options {
00129     my $self = shift;
00130     my $rh_option = shift;
00131     $self->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY] = $rh_option if defined $rh_option; # not sure why this needs to be done
00132     $self->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY];     # provides a reference to the options hash MEG
00133 }

00143 sub trace {
00144     my $self = shift;
00145     my $rows = $self->[1];
00146     my $cols = $self->[2];
00147     warn "Can't take trace of non-square matrix " unless $rows == $cols;
00148     my $sum = 0;
00149     for( my $i = 0; $i<$rows;$i++) {
00150         $sum +=$self->[0][$i][$i];
00151     }
00152     $sum;
00153 }

00161 sub new_from_array_ref {  # this will build a matrix or a row vector from  [a, b, c, ]
00162     my $class = shift;
00163     my $array = shift;
00164     my $rows = @$array;
00165     my $cols = @{$array->[0]};
00166     my $matrix = new Matrix($rows,$cols);
00167     $matrix->[0]=$array;
00168     $matrix;
00169 }

00188 sub list {           # this is used only for column vectors
00189     my $self = shift;
00190     my @list = ();
00191     warn "This only works with column vectors" unless $self->[2] == 1;
00192     my $rows = $self->[1];
00193     for(my $i=1; $i<=$rows; $i++) {
00194         push(@list, $self->element($i,1) );
00195     }
00196     @list;
00197 }

00205 sub new_from_list {   # this builds a row vector from an array
00206     my $class = shift;
00207     my @list = @_;
00208     my $cols = @list;
00209     my $rows = 1;
00210     my $matrix = new Matrix($rows, $cols);
00211     my $i=1;
00212     while(@list) {
00213         my $elem = shift(@list);
00214         $matrix->assign($i++,1, $elem);
00215     }
00216     $matrix;
00217 }

00245 sub proj{
00246     my $self = shift;
00247     my ($vec) = @_;
00248     $self * $self ->proj_coeff($vec);
00249 }

00257 sub proj_coeff{
00258     my $self= shift;
00259     my ($vec) = @_;
00260     warn 'The vector must be of type Matrix',ref($vec),"|" unless ref($vec) eq 'Matrix';
00261     my $lin_space_tr= ~ $self;
00262     my $matrix = $lin_space_tr * $self;
00263     $vec = $lin_space_tr*$vec;
00264     my $matrix_lr = $matrix->decompose_LR;
00265     my ($dim,$x_vector, $base_matrix) = $matrix_lr->solve_LR($vec);
00266     warn "A unique adapted answer could not be determined.  Possibly the parameters have coefficient zero.<br>  dim = $dim base_matrix is $base_matrix\n" if $dim;  # only print if the dim is not zero.
00267     $x_vector;
00268 }

00276 sub new_column_matrix {
00277     my $class = shift;
00278     my $vec = shift;
00279     warn "The argument to assign column must be a reference to an array" unless ref($vec) =~/ARRAY/;
00280     my $cols = 1;
00281     my $rows = @{$vec};
00282     my $matrix = new Matrix($rows,1);
00283     foreach my $i (1..$rows) {
00284         $matrix->assign($i,1,$vec->[$i-1]);
00285     }
00286     $matrix;
00287 }

00289 =head4

00291     This method takes an array of column vectors, or an array of arrays,

00294     
00295     Method $matrix->new_from_col_vecs

00299 sub new_from_col_vecs
00300 {
00301     my $class = shift;
00302     my($vecs) = shift;
00303     my($rows,$cols);
00304 
00305     if(ref($vecs->[0])eq 'Matrix' ){
00306         ($rows,$cols) = (scalar($vecs->[0]->[1]),scalar(@$vecs));
00307     }else{
00308         ($rows,$cols) = (scalar(@{$vecs->[0]}),scalar(@$vecs));
00309     }
00310 
00311     my($i,$j);
00312         my $matrix = Matrix->new($rows,$cols);
00313 
00314     if(ref($vecs->[0])eq 'Matrix' ){
00315             for ( $i = 0; $i < $cols; $i++ )
00316             {
00317                 for( $j = 0; $j < $rows; $j++ )
00318             {
00319                     $matrix->[0][$j][$i] = $vecs->[$i][0][$j][0];
00320             }
00321             }
00322     }else{
00323         for ( $i = 0; $i < $cols; $i++ )
00324             {
00325                 for( $j = 0; $j < $rows; $j++ )
00326             {
00327                     $matrix->[0][$j][$i] = $vecs->[$i]->[$j];
00328             }
00329             }
00330     }
00331         return($matrix);
00332 }

00350 sub cp  { # MEG  makes new copies of complex number
00351     my $z = shift;
00352     return $z unless ref($z);
00353     my $w = Complex1::cplx($z->Re,$z->Im);
00354     return $w;
00355 }

00363 sub copy
00364 {
00365     croak "Usage: \$matrix1->copy(\$matrix2);"
00366       if (@_ != 2);
00367 
00368     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00369     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00370     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00371     my($i,$j);
00372 
00373     croak "MatrixReal1::copy(): matrix size mismatch"
00374       unless (($rows1 == $rows2) && ($cols1 == $cols2));
00375 
00376     for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++ )
00377     {
00378     my $r1 = []; # New array ref
00379     my $r2 = $matrix2->[0][$i];
00380     #@$r1 = @$r2; # Copy whole array directly  #MEG
00381     # if the array contains complex objects new objects must be created.
00382     foreach (@$r2) {
00383         push(@$r1,cp($_) );
00384     }
00385     $matrix1->[0][$i] = $r1;
00386     }
00387         $matrix1->[3] = $matrix2->[3]; # sign or option
00388     if (defined $matrix2->[4]) # is an LR decomposition matrix!
00389     {
00390     #    $matrix1->[3] = $matrix2->[3]; # $sign
00391         $matrix1->[4] = $matrix2->[4]; # $perm_row
00392         $matrix1->[5] = $matrix2->[5]; # $perm_col
00393         $matrix1->[6] = $matrix2->[6]; # $option
00394     }
00395 }

00406 sub conj {
00407     my $elem = shift;
00408     $elem = (ref($elem)) ? ($elem->conjugate) : $elem;
00409     $elem;
00410 }

00418 sub transpose
00419 {
00420     croak "Usage: \$matrix1->transpose(\$matrix2);"
00421       if (@_ != 2);
00422 
00423     my($matrix1,$matrix2) = @_;
00424     my($rows1,$cols1) = ($matrix1->[1],$matrix1->[2]);
00425     my($rows2,$cols2) = ($matrix2->[1],$matrix2->[2]);
00426 
00427     croak "MatrixReal1::transpose(): matrix size mismatch"
00428       unless (($rows1 == $cols2) && ($cols1 == $rows2));
00429 
00430     $matrix1->_undo_LR();
00431 
00432     if ($rows1 == $cols1)
00433     {
00434         # more complicated to make in-place possible!
00435         # # conj added by MEG
00436         for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++)
00437         {
00438             for (my $j = ($i + 1); $j < $cols1; $j++)
00439             {   
00440                 my $swap              = conj($matrix2->[0][$i][$j]);
00441                 $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] = conj($matrix2->[0][$j][$i]);
00442                 $matrix1->[0][$j][$i] = $swap;
00443             }
00444             $matrix1->[0][$i][$i] = conj($matrix2->[0][$i][$i]);
00445         }
00446        
00447     }
00448     else # ($rows1 != $cols1)
00449     {
00450         for (my $i = 0; $i < $rows1; $i++)
00451         {
00452             for (my $j = 0; $j < $cols1; $j++)
00453             {
00454                 $matrix1->[0][$i][$j] = conj($matrix2->[0][$j][$i]);
00455             }
00456         }
00457     }
00458     $matrix1;
00459 }

00461 =head4
00462 
00463     Method $matrix->decompose_LR

00467 sub decompose_LR
00468 {
00469     croak "Usage: \$LR_matrix = \$matrix->decompose_LR();"
00470       if (@_ != 1);
00471 
00472     my($matrix) = @_;
00473     my($rows,$cols) = ($matrix->[1],$matrix->[2]);
00474     my($perm_row,$perm_col);
00475     my($row,$col,$max);
00476     my($i,$j,$k,);
00477     my($sign) = 1;
00478     my($swap);
00479     my($temp);
00480     my $rh_options = $matrix->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY];
00481 #    FIXEME Why won't this work on non-square matrices?
00482 #    croak "MatrixReal1::decompose_LR(): matrix is not quadratic"
00483 #      unless ($rows == $cols);
00484 #    croak "MatrixReal1::decompose_LR(): matrix has more rows than columns"
00485 #      unless ($rows <= $cols);
00486 
00487     $temp = $matrix->new($rows,$cols);
00488     $temp->copy($matrix);
00489 #    $n = $rows;
00490     $perm_row = [ ];
00491     $perm_col = [ ];
00492     for ( my $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )  { $perm_row->[$i] = $i;} #i is a row number   
00493     for (my $j=0;$j<$cols;$j++) {    $perm_col->[$j] = $j; }
00494     NONZERO:
00495     for ( $k = 0; $k < $rows; $k++ ) # use Gauss's algorithm:  #k is row number
00496     {
00497         # complete pivot-search:
00498 
00499         $max = 0;
00500         for ( $i = $k; $i < $rows; $i++ )   # i is row number
00501         {
00502             for ( $j = $k; $j < $cols; $j++ )  #j is a col number
00503             {
00504                 if (($swap = abs($temp->[0][$i][$j])) > $max)
00505                 {
00506                     $max = $swap;
00507                     $row = $i;
00508                     $col = $j;
00509                 }
00510             }
00511         }
00512         # warn "max is $max row is $row and col is $col and k is $k";
00513         last NONZERO if ($max == 0); # (all remaining elements are zero)
00514         if ($k != $row) # swap row $k and row $row:
00515         {
00516             $sign = -$sign;
00517             $swap             = $perm_row->[$k];
00518             $perm_row->[$k]   = $perm_row->[$row];
00519             $perm_row->[$row] = $swap;
00520             for ( $j = 0; $j < $cols; $j++ )   # j is a column number
00521             {
00522                 # (must run from 0 since L has to be swapped too!)
00523 
00524                 $swap                = $temp->[0][$k][$j];
00525                 $temp->[0][$k][$j]   = $temp->[0][$row][$j];
00526                 $temp->[0][$row][$j] = $swap;
00527             }
00528         }
00529         if ($k != $col) # swap column $k and column $col:
00530         {   my $swap;  # localize variable MEG
00531             $sign = -$sign;
00532             $swap             = $perm_col->[$k];
00533             $perm_col->[$k]   = $perm_col->[$col];
00534             $perm_col->[$col] = $swap;
00535             for ( $i = 0; $i < $rows; $i++ )   #i is a row number
00536             {
00537                 $swap                = $temp->[0][$i][$k];
00538                 $temp->[0][$i][$k]   = $temp->[0][$i][$col];
00539                 $temp->[0][$i][$col] = $swap;
00540             }
00541         }
00542         for (my $i = ($k + 1); $i < $rows; $i++ )   # i is row number
00543         {
00544             # scan the remaining rows, add multiples of row $k to row $i:
00545 
00546             $swap = $temp->[0][$i][$k] / $temp->[0][$k][$k];
00547             if ($swap != 0)
00548             {
00549                 # calculate a row of matrix R:
00550 
00551                 for (my $j = ($k + 1); $j < $cols; $j++ )   #j is  a column number
00552                 {
00553                     $temp->[0][$i][$j] -= $temp->[0][$k][$j] * $swap;
00554                 }
00555 
00556                 # store matrix L in same matrix as R:
00557                 $temp->[0][$i][$k] = $swap;
00558             }
00559         }
00560     }
00561     #my $rh_options = $temp->[3];
00562     $temp->[3] = $sign;
00563     $temp->[4] = $perm_row;
00564     $temp->[5] = $perm_col;
00565     $temp->[$MatrixReal1::OPTION_ENTRY] = $rh_options;
00566     return($temp);
00567 }
